core.trade

Class TradeFunctionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.trade.TradeFunctionManager

  • public class TradeFunctionManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that manage actions and information stored in Trade, extends from TradeManager. Note that this class does not mutate any Item.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TradeFunctionManager(int newestTradeId)
      Construct a UserTradeManager with a list of trades, maxIncompleteTrade, maxWeeklyTransaction, newestTradeId

    • Constructor Detail

      • TradeFunctionManager

        public TradeFunctionManager(int newestTradeId)
        Construct a UserTradeManager with a list of trades, maxIncompleteTrade, maxWeeklyTransaction, newestTradeId
        Parameters:
        newestTradeId - the id of the most recent Trade id.

    • Method Detail

      • requestTrade

        public ActionReverter requestTrade(java.lang.String username1,
                                   java.lang.String username2,
                                   Item item1To2,
                                   Item item2To1,
                                   boolean isPermanent,
                                   java.util.List<Trade> trades)
        User with username1 initiate a Trade to be accepted by User with username2.

        Precondition: There exists User with username1 and User with username2.

        Parameters:
        username1 - username of the initiator of the Trade.
        username2 - username of the responder of the Trade.
        item1To2 - Item lent by username1 to username2.
        item2To1 - Item lent by username2 to username1.
        isPermanent - Equals true if the Trade initiated is a permanent Trade, false if it is a temporary Trade.
        trades - a collection of all Trades currently stored
        Returns:
        a RequestTradeReverter where the passed in arguments(parameters) include this Trade, the initiator of this Trade, and a collection of all Trades currently stored

      • cancelTrade

        public void cancelTrade(Trade trade)
        Changes the status of Trade to cancelled.
        Parameters:
        trade - the Trade that needs to be cancelled.

      • agreeToTrade

        public int agreeToTrade(Trade trade,
                        java.lang.String username)
        Agrees to a Trade request. Before this function returns true, this Trade is not started. Action is successful iff user with username is the responder of this Trade.
        Parameters:
        trade - the Trade that user agree to a trade request.
        username - the username of the user calling this.
        Returns:
        0 agree to trade successfully, 1 fail because user is the initiator, 2 fail because trade is NOT_STARTED, other digit means unknown reason.

      • denyTrade

        public Pair<ActionReverter,java.lang.Integer> denyTrade(Trade trade,
                                                        java.lang.String username)
        Denys a a Trade request. The status of the trade will be DENIED. Action is successful iff user with username is the responder of this Trade.
        Parameters:
        trade - the Trade that user agree to a trade request.
        username - the username of the user calling this.
        Returns:
        Pair with value1 null or ActionReverter of this action, value2 as 0 deny trade successfully, 1 fail because user is the initiator, 2 fail because trade is NOT_STARTED, other digit means unknown reason.

      • addMeetingRelated

        public boolean addMeetingRelated(Trade trade,
                                 java.lang.Integer meetingNumber)
        Adds the meetingId of a meeting related to given Trade. Return true iff the action succeeded
        Parameters:
        trade - the Trade need its meeting added.
        meetingNumber - the id of meeting.
        Returns:
        true iff the meeting is added

      • updateTradeOneMeeting

        public boolean updateTradeOneMeeting(Trade trade)
        Updates the Trade status as one meeting has completed.
        Parameters:
        trade - the Trade that has one meeting completed.
        Returns:
        true if this Trade exists and is completed, false if it is still not completed yet.

      • updateTradesAbandoned

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> updateTradesAbandoned(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> meetingIds,
                                                              java.util.List<Trade> trades)
        Checks all trades and change status of trades that has late meeting to "abandoned". A trade is abandoned when the meeting is arranged by the two users but at least one of them does not confirm the meeting has occurred maxMeetingLateTime days after the proposed meeting time.
        Parameters:
        meetingIds - a list of ids of meetings that are late.
        trades - all trades that will be checked
        Returns:
        list of username of Users involved in abandoned trade.

      • getNewestTradeId

        public int getNewestTradeId()
        Return the newest trade id
        Returns:
        the newest trade id
